Care.origin: [a person has a duty to use in dealing with others, and failure to do so is negligence "R. I. Mehr"]

1.definition: watchful or protective attention, caution, concern, prudence, or regard usually towards an action or situation[a person has a duty to use in dealing with others, and failure to do so is negligence "R. I. Mehr"] see also,,
1.note: Statute, case law, and custom often impose a duty of care. The degree or standard of care owed varies depending on the circumstances. For example, a landlord has to exercise greater care in relation to a tenant than to a trespasser.
